verses.text: O Christian, awake! 'tis the Master's command; With helmet and shield, and a sword in thy hand, To meet the bold tempter, go, fearlessly go, And stand like the brave, with thy face to the foe.
What tho' like a lion he seeketh his prey; Take heed and beware of his cunning today; The cause of thy Master with vigor defend; Be watchful, be sober, on Christ still depend.
Press on, never doubting, thy Captain is near, With grace to supply, and with comfort to cheer; His love, like a stream in the desert, will flow, And stand like the brave, with thy face to the foe.
